title: Is the mental damage of cannabis permanent? - Quora

response.answer_text: Cannabis is generally seen as the least dangerous of all illegal drugs, and infrequent use is probably not harmful. However, current scientific research suggests that marijuana may be hazardous to normal brain development in adolescence,[1, 3] and even in adults heavy use is associated with poor memory [2] and lower IQ. [4] "When the first exposure occurs in younger versus older adolescents, the impact of cannabis seems to be worse in regard to many outcomes such as mental health, education attainment, delinquency and ability to conform to adult role" [1] Why do people get addicted to cannabis? It turns out that it reduces the amount of naturally produced dopamine in the striatum. [5] A commonsense answer to this question, based on the very well-known mental effects, is that if you spend a long period of time in a cognitively challenged state then your intelligence will reflect that state. The more time you spend stoned, the longer the road back to normality. [1] Perception of marijuana as a 'safe drug' is scientifically inaccurate Original study: Trajectory of Adolescent Cannabis Use on Addiction Vulnerability - Hurd YL, Michaelides M, Miller ML, Jutras-Aswad D., 2014 [2] Heavy marijuana users have abnormal brain structure and poor memory [3] Marijuana use in adolescence may cause permanent brain abnormalities, study finds [4] Study shows marijuana's long-term effects on the brain [5] Long-term cannabis use may blunt the brain's motivation system
